p: ZIKV titers in the mosquito bodies did not significantly differ among the four Aedes spp. tested ( Fig 2). In contrast there was a significant difference ( P = 0.0014) in the ZIKV titers in the legs+wings between these species. Importantly, transmission of ZIKV by Ae. aegypti on day 14 post exposure occurred only when the titer of ZIKV in the legs+wings was â‰¥ 10 5.6 TCID 50 equivalents/mL, with all individuals at or above this threshold able to transmit ZIKV.
